text: Indirect presidential elections were held in Colombia in 1886. Rafael Núñez was elected unanimously. ==Background== Following the promulgation of the 1886 constitution, the Council of Delegates selected a president and vice president to serve a six-year term until elections in 1892.Elections and Events 1850-1899 The Library, UC San Diego The Council also elected the Designdao, a designated replacement for the president. ==Results== ===President=== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Candidate !Votes !% |- |align=left|Rafael Núñez||18||100 |- |align=left|Total||18||100 |- |align=left colspan=3|Source: Historia electoral colombianaHistoria electoral colombiana, La Registraduría, 1991, p134 |} ===Vice President=== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Candidate !Votes !% |- |align=left|Eliseo Payán||18||100 |- |align=left|Total||18||100 |- |align=left colspan=3|Source: Historia electoral colombiana |} ===Designado=== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Candidate !Votes !% |- |align=left|José María Campo Serrano||17||94.4 |- |align=left|Antonio Roldán Betancourt||1||5.6 |- |align=left|Total||18||100 |- |align=left colspan=3|Source: Historia electoral colombiana |} ==References== Category:1886 elections in South America 1886 Category:1886 in Colombia
title: 1886 Colombian presidential election
